entities.description: Experiencing problems with emotions, mental health, or physical health due to cocaine use.
Needing a lot more cocaine to get the desired feeling or using the same amount with less effect.
Experiencing withdrawal symptoms when trying to stop or cut down cocaine use.
Using the same or similar substances to avoid cocaine withdrawal symptoms.
Experiencing problems at work, school, home, or with family due to heroin use.
Using heroin in larger amounts or over a longer time than intended.
Unable to cut down or stop using heroin despite trying.
Spending a great deal of time using or trying to get heroin.
Having a strong urge to use heroin or thinking about it constantly.

relationships.description: Relates cocaine use to problems with emotions, mental health, or physical health.
Indicates that cocaine use leads to needing more cocaine for the same effect.
Relates cocaine use to experiencing withdrawal symptoms.
Indicates that withdrawal symptoms lead to using similar substances to avoid them.
Relates heroin use to problems at work, school, home, or with family.
Indicates that heroin use leads to using larger amounts over time.
Relates heroin use to being unable to quit despite trying.
Indicates that heroin use involves spending a lot of time using or trying to get the drug.
Relates heroin use to having a strong urge or constant thoughts about using.
